citeinfo.title: Complete fits from metabolism estimation models
citeinfo.geoform: tab-separated values and text files, 5 files per SITENUM_RES combination, packaged and compressed in .zip format.

descript.abstract: This dataset provides complete fits from metabolism estimation models. This dataset is part of a larger data release that provides modeled estimates of gross primary productivity, ecosystem respiration, and gas exchange coefficients for 356 streams and rivers across the United States. The release also includes the model input data and alternative input data, model fit and diagnostic information, spatial data for the modeled sites (catchment boundaries and site point locations), and potential predictors of metabolism such as discharge and light availability.
descript.purpose: A continental-scale quantification of energy flow in streams and rivers can facilitate better understanding of links between aquatic energy cycling and ecosystem services, the seasonality and dynamism of stream energy flow, and the effects of human activities on aquatic activity. This data release provides multi-day time series estimates of energy flow as metabolism (gross primary productivity and ecosystem respiration) for 356 streams and rivers across the United States.

spdom.descgeog: Stream and river monitoring sites in the U.S. Geological Survey's observation network

place.placekt: Department of Commerce, 1995, Countries, Dependencies, Areas of Special Sovereignty, and Their Principal Administrative Divisions, Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) 10-4, Washington, D.C., National Institute of Standards and Technology

U.S. Department of Commerce, 1987, Codes for the identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the outlying areas of the United States, and associated areas (Federal Information Processing Standard 5-2): Washington, D. C., NIST

idinfo.useconst: None, but see Distribution Liability below. Users are advised to read the associated publication thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.
idinfo.datacred: This work was funded by the USGS Powell Center (Working Group title: "Continental-scale overview of stream primary productivity, its links to water quality, and consequences for aquatic carbon biogeochemistry"). Additional financial support came from the USGS NAWQA program and Office of Water Information. NSF grants DEB-1146283 and EF1442501 partially supported ROH. The USGS Wisconsin Modeling Center provided access to the HTCondor cluster for generating metabolism estimates.
idinfo.native: This dataset was generated using open source tools available in the R programming language (R version 3.4.3 (2017-11-30)). The computing platform for generating data and metadata was Windows (x86_64-w64-mingw32). R packages used: streamMetabolizer version 0.10.1; dplyr version 0.7.4; magrittr version 1.5; meddle version 0.0.4; sbtools version 1.1.6; whisker version 0.3-2; yaml version 2.1.17.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

citeinfo.title: Overcoming Equifinality: Leveraging Long Time Series for Stream Metabolism Estimation
citeinfo.geoform: tab-separated values and text files, 5 files per SITENUM_RES combination, packaged and compressed in .zip format.

srcinfo.srccontr: This methods manuscript justifies the metabolism model implementation used to generate metabolism estimates for this project.

citeinfo.title: streamMetabolizer: Models for Estimating Aquatic Photosynthesis and Respiration, version 0.10.1
citeinfo.geoform: tab-separated values and text files, 5 files per SITENUM_RES combination, packaged and compressed in .zip format.

srcinfo.srccontr: This software source provided the metabolism model implementation used to generate metabolism estimates for this project. See https://dx.doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.838795 for an archived copy of the source code exactly as used for this project. See https://owi.usgs.gov/R/gran.html for instructions on how to access current versions of the software from the U.S. Geological Survey archive.

procstep.procdesc: Metabolism was estimated using the streamMetabolizer package (Appling et al. 2017, 2018) version 0.10.1 using the Bayesian model with streamMetabolizer model name "b_Kb_oipi_tr_plrckm.stan", and using the site-specific configuration parameters and data sources specified in "Model configurations for estimating metabolism". Parameter estimates and diagnostics were extracted from the models using the get_fit() function from streamMetabolizer. Each element of the resulting list was written to a separate tab-separated text file, then the set of files for each model was compressed into a zip file for release.

enttyp.enttypd: MCMC distribution statistics for daily model estimates of mean gross primary production (GPP), ecosystem respiration (ER), and the gas exchange rate coefficient (K600).

attr.attrdef: Primary date to which the fitted values apply, Y-M-D format, for the period from 4am on that date to 3:59am on the following date.
Mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the GPP_daily parameter, where GPP_daily is the mean gross primary productivity (GPP) for this date.
Standard error of the mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the GPP_daily parameter, where GPP_daily is the mean gross primary productivity (GPP) for this date.
Standard deviation of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the GPP_daily parameter, where GPP_daily is the mean gross primary productivity (GPP) for this date.
The 2.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the GPP_daily parameter, where GPP_daily is the mean gross primary productivity (GPP) for this date.
The 25th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the GPP_daily parameter, where GPP_daily is the mean gross primary productivity (GPP) for this date.
The 50th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the GPP_daily parameter, where GPP_daily is the mean gross primary productivity (GPP) for this date.
The 75th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the GPP_daily parameter, where GPP_daily is the mean gross primary productivity (GPP) for this date.
The 97.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the GPP_daily parameter, where GPP_daily is the mean gross primary productivity (GPP) for this date.
Estimated effective sample size of the MCMC sampling for the GPP_daily parameter, where GPP_daily is the mean gross primary productivity (GPP) for this date.

R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for the GPP_daily parameter, where GPP_daily is the mean gross primary productivity (GPP) for this date. Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.
Mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the ER_daily parameter, where ER_daily is the mean ecosystem respiration (ER) for this date, and more negative values indicate more respiration.

Standard error of the mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the ER_daily parameter, where ER_daily is the mean ecosystem respiration (ER) for this date, and more negative values indicate more respiration.

Standard deviation of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the ER_daily parameter, where ER_daily is the mean ecosystem respiration (ER) for this date, and more negative values indicate more respiration.

The 2.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the ER_daily parameter, where ER_daily is the mean ecosystem respiration (ER) for this date, and more negative values indicate more respiration.

The 25th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the ER_daily parameter, where ER_daily is the mean ecosystem respiration (ER) for this date, and more negative values indicate more respiration.

The 50th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the ER_daily parameter, where ER_daily is the mean ecosystem respiration (ER) for this date, and more negative values indicate more respiration.

The 75th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the ER_daily parameter, where ER_daily is the mean ecosystem respiration (ER) for this date, and more negative values indicate more respiration.

The 97.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the ER_daily parameter, where ER_daily is the mean ecosystem respiration (ER) for this date, and more negative values indicate more respiration.

Estimated effective sample size of the MCMC sampling for the ER_daily parameter, where ER_daily is the mean ecosystem respiration (ER) for this date, and more negative values indicate more respiration.

R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for the ER_daily parameter, where ER_daily is the mean ecosystem respiration (ER) for this date, and more negative values indicate more respiration. Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.
Mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600, for this date.

Standard error of the mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600, for this date.
Standard deviation of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600, for this date.
The 2.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600, for this date.
The 25th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600, for this date.
The 50th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600, for this date.
The 75th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600, for this date.
The 97.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600, for this date.
Estimated effective sample size of the MCMC sampling for the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600, for this date.

R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for the K600_daily parameter, where K600_daily is the mean reaeration rate coefficient, scaled to a Schmidt number of 600, for this date. Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.
Mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_predlog parameter, giving the hierarchical estimate for any date with this date's mean daily discharge, in natural log space.

Standard error of the mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_predlog parameter, giving the hierarchical estimate for any date with this date's mean daily discharge, in natural log space.
Standard deviation of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_predlog parameter, giving the hierarchical estimate for any date with this date's mean daily discharge, in natural log space.
The 2.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_predlog parameter, giving the hierarchical estimate for any date with this date's mean daily discharge, in natural log space.
The 25th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_predlog parameter, giving the hierarchical estimate for any date with this date's mean daily discharge, in natural log space.

The 75th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_predlog parameter, giving the hierarchical estimate for any date with this date's mean daily discharge, in natural log space.

The 97.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_predlog parameter, giving the hierarchical estimate for any date with this date's mean daily discharge, in natural log space.
Estimated effective sample size of the MCMC sampling for the K600_daily_predlog parameter, giving the hierarchical estimate for any date with this date's mean daily discharge, in natural log space.

R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for the K600_daily_predlog parameter, giving the hierarchical estimate for any date with this date's mean daily discharge, in natural log space. Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.
TRUE if the input data for this date were considered valid and included in the model, FALSE otherwise
Date-specific warnings about input data
Date-specific problems with input data that prevented model fitting on that date and drove the setting of valid_day to FALSE

rdom.rdommax: uneven timesteps; timestep != 0.04166667 d; NAs in DO.sat; NAs in temp.water

enttyp.enttypd: MCMC distribution statistics for K600_daily_sigma, a parameter relating specific daily estimates of the gas exchange rate coefficient (K600) to predictions from the piecewise linear relationship between K600 and discharge (Q) fitted for each monitoring site.

attr.attrdef: Always NA in KQ_overall.tsv. Integer index of a 24-hour period from 4am to the following 3:59am, modeled as a single date.
Always NA in KQ_overall.tsv. Integer index of a time within a date, e.g., observations 15-minute resolution are given time_index values of 1 (4am) through 96 (3:45am nearly 24 hours later).
Always 1 in KQ_overall.tsv. Integer index of the parameters described in later columns.

Mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_sigma parameter, giving the fitted estimate of the standard deviation of K600_daily values relative to the exp(K600_daily_predlog) values on the same dates.

Standard error of the mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_sigma parameter, giving the fitted estimate of the standard deviation of K600_daily values relative to the exp(K600_daily_predlog) values on the same dates.

Standard deviation of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_sigma parameter, giving the fitted estimate of the standard deviation of K600_daily values relative to the exp(K600_daily_predlog) values on the same dates.

The 2.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_sigma parameter, giving the fitted estimate of the standard deviation of K600_daily values relative to the exp(K600_daily_predlog) values on the same dates.

The 25th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_sigma parameter, giving the fitted estimate of the standard deviation of K600_daily values relative to the exp(K600_daily_predlog) values on the same dates.

The 50th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_sigma parameter, giving the fitted estimate of the standard deviation of K600_daily values relative to the exp(K600_daily_predlog) values on the same dates.

The 75th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_sigma parameter, giving the fitted estimate of the standard deviation of K600_daily values relative to the exp(K600_daily_predlog) values on the same dates.

The 97.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the K600_daily_sigma parameter, giving the fitted estimate of the standard deviation of K600_daily values relative to the exp(K600_daily_predlog) values on the same dates.

Estimated effective sample size of the MCMC sampling for the K600_daily_sigma parameter, giving the fitted estimate of the standard deviation of K600_daily values relative to the exp(K600_daily_predlog) values on the same dates.

R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for the K600_daily_sigma parameter, giving the fitted estimate of the standard deviation of K600_daily values relative to the exp(K600_daily_predlog) values on the same dates. Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.

enttyp.enttypd: MCMC distribution statistics for the fitted standard deviations of observation errors and process errors and the overall log posterior probability of all parameter values in each MCMC iteration.

attr.attrdef: Always NA in overall.tsv. Integer index of a 24-hour period from 4am to the following 3:59am, modeled as a single date.
Always NA in overall.tsv. Integer index of a time within a date, e.g., observations 15-minute resolution are given time_index values of 1 (4am) through 96 (3:45am nearly 24 hours later).
Always 1 in overall.tsv. Integer index of the parameters described in later columns.

Mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_obs_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of observation errors (differences between observed and modeled oxygen concentrations).

Standard error of the mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_obs_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of observation errors (differences between observed and modeled oxygen concentrations).

Standard deviation of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_obs_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of observation errors (differences between observed and modeled oxygen concentrations).

The 2.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_obs_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of observation errors (differences between observed and modeled oxygen concentrations).

The 25th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_obs_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of observation errors (differences between observed and modeled oxygen concentrations).

The 50th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_obs_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of observation errors (differences between observed and modeled oxygen concentrations).

The 75th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_obs_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of observation errors (differences between observed and modeled oxygen concentrations).

The 97.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_obs_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of observation errors (differences between observed and modeled oxygen concentrations).

Estimated effective sample size of the MCMC sampling for the err_obs_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of observation errors (differences between observed and modeled oxygen concentrations).

R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for the err_obs_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of observation errors (differences between observed and modeled oxygen concentrations). Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.

Mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_proc_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of process errors (differences between rates of oxygen concentration change as modeled by the overall state-space model and the deterministic component of the model).

Standard error of the mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_proc_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of process errors (differences between rates of oxygen concentration change as modeled by the overall state-space model and the deterministic component of the model).

Standard deviation of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_proc_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of process errors (differences between rates of oxygen concentration change as modeled by the overall state-space model and the deterministic component of the model).

The 2.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_proc_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of process errors (differences between rates of oxygen concentration change as modeled by the overall state-space model and the deterministic component of the model).

The 25th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_proc_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of process errors (differences between rates of oxygen concentration change as modeled by the overall state-space model and the deterministic component of the model).

The 50th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_proc_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of process errors (differences between rates of oxygen concentration change as modeled by the overall state-space model and the deterministic component of the model).

The 75th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_proc_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of process errors (differences between rates of oxygen concentration change as modeled by the overall state-space model and the deterministic component of the model).

The 97.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of the err_proc_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of process errors (differences between rates of oxygen concentration change as modeled by the overall state-space model and the deterministic component of the model).

Estimated effective sample size of the MCMC sampling for the err_proc_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of process errors (differences between rates of oxygen concentration change as modeled by the overall state-space model and the deterministic component of the model).

R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for the err_proc_iid_sigma parameter, giving the fitted standard deviation of process errors (differences between rates of oxygen concentration change as modeled by the overall state-space model and the deterministic component of the model). Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.
Mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of log posterior density for each MCMC iteration.
Standard error of the mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of log posterior density for each MCMC iteration.
Standard deviation of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of log posterior density for each MCMC iteration.
The 2.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of log posterior density for each MCMC iteration.
The 25th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of log posterior density for each MCMC iteration.
The 50th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of log posterior density for each MCMC iteration.
The 75th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of log posterior density for each MCMC iteration.
The 97.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of log posterior density for each MCMC iteration.
Estimated effective sample size of the MCMC sampling for log posterior density for each MCMC iteration.
R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for log posterior density for each MCMC iteration. Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.

enttyp.enttypd: MCMC distribution statistics for parameters describing the ln(K600) values of the endpoints and breakpoints of the piecewise linear relationship between K600 and Q fitted for each monitoring site.

attr.attrdef: Always NA in KQ_binned.tsv. Integer index of a 24-hour period from 4am to the following 3:59am, modeled as a single date.
Always NA in KQ_binned.tsv. Integer index of a time within a date, e.g., observations 15-minute resolution are given time_index values of 1 (4am) through 96 (3:45am nearly 24 hours later).

Integer index of the lnK600_lnQ_nodes parameter described in later columns, where each indexed value of lnK600_lnQ_nodes gives a junction point of the fitted piecewise linear relationship between K600 and discharge (Q).

Mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of one of the lnK600_lnQ_nodes parameters describing a site-specific, piecewise linear relationship between ln(K600) and ln(Q). Each indexed parameter is the fitted ln(K600) value corresponding to a fixed value of ln(Q). The values of ln(Q) for each model are defined in the K600_lnQ_nodes_centers column of config.zip..

Standard error of the mean of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of one of the lnK600_lnQ_nodes parameters describing a site-specific, piecewise linear relationship between ln(K600) and ln(Q). Each indexed parameter is the fitted ln(K600) value corresponding to a fixed value of ln(Q). The values of ln(Q) for each model are defined in the K600_lnQ_nodes_centers column of config.zip..

Standard deviation of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of one of the lnK600_lnQ_nodes parameters describing a site-specific, piecewise linear relationship between ln(K600) and ln(Q). Each indexed parameter is the fitted ln(K600) value corresponding to a fixed value of ln(Q). The values of ln(Q) for each model are defined in the K600_lnQ_nodes_centers column of config.zip..

The 2.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of one of the lnK600_lnQ_nodes parameters describing a site-specific, piecewise linear relationship between ln(K600) and ln(Q). Each indexed parameter is the fitted ln(K600) value corresponding to a fixed value of ln(Q). The values of ln(Q) for each model are defined in the K600_lnQ_nodes_centers column of config.zip..

The 25th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of one of the lnK600_lnQ_nodes parameters describing a site-specific, piecewise linear relationship between ln(K600) and ln(Q). Each indexed parameter is the fitted ln(K600) value corresponding to a fixed value of ln(Q). The values of ln(Q) for each model are defined in the K600_lnQ_nodes_centers column of config.zip..

The 50th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of one of the lnK600_lnQ_nodes parameters describing a site-specific, piecewise linear relationship between ln(K600) and ln(Q). Each indexed parameter is the fitted ln(K600) value corresponding to a fixed value of ln(Q). The values of ln(Q) for each model are defined in the K600_lnQ_nodes_centers column of config.zip..

The 75th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of one of the lnK600_lnQ_nodes parameters describing a site-specific, piecewise linear relationship between ln(K600) and ln(Q). Each indexed parameter is the fitted ln(K600) value corresponding to a fixed value of ln(Q). The values of ln(Q) for each model are defined in the K600_lnQ_nodes_centers column of config.zip..

The 97.5th quantile of the post-warmup MCMC distribution of one of the lnK600_lnQ_nodes parameters describing a site-specific, piecewise linear relationship between ln(K600) and ln(Q). Each indexed parameter is the fitted ln(K600) value corresponding to a fixed value of ln(Q). The values of ln(Q) for each model are defined in the K600_lnQ_nodes_centers column of config.zip..

Estimated effective sample size of the MCMC sampling for one of the lnK600_lnQ_nodes parameters describing a site-specific, piecewise linear relationship between ln(K600) and ln(Q). Each indexed parameter is the fitted ln(K600) value corresponding to a fixed value of ln(Q). The values of ln(Q) for each model are defined in the K600_lnQ_nodes_centers column of config.zip..

R-hat statistic of the MCMC sampling for one of the lnK600_lnQ_nodes parameters describing a site-specific, piecewise linear relationship between ln(K600) and ln(Q). Each indexed parameter is the fitted ln(K600) value corresponding to a fixed value of ln(Q). The values of ln(Q) for each model are defined in the K600_lnQ_nodes_centers column of config.zip.. Values near or below 1.05 indicate convergence of the MCMC chains.

enttyp.enttypd: Warnings given by the Stan software for each MCMC model run.

attr.attrdef: Warnings produced for this model run (all dates) by the Stan MCMC software.

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: This information is preliminary or provisional and is subject to revision. It is being provided to meet the need for timely best science. The information has not received final approval by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and is provided on the condition that neither the USGS nor the U.S. Government shall be held liable for any damages resulting from the authorized or unauthorized use of the information.
